00014 #ifndef ULIB_RPC_METHOD_H
00015 #define ULIB_RPC_METHOD_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/string.h>
00018 
00031 // Forward declaration
00032 
00033 class URPCFault;
00034 class URPCEncoder;
00035 class URPCEnvelope;
00036 
00037 class U_EXPORT URPCMethod {
00038 public:
00039 
00040         // Check for memory error
00041         U_MEMORY_TEST
00042 
00043         // Allocator e Deallocator
00044         U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR
00045         U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR
00046 
00047         static UString* str_done;
00048         static UString* str_fault;
00049 
00050         static void str_allocate();
00051 
00052         // COSTRUTTORI
00053 
00054         URPCMethod()
00055                 {
00056                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCMethod, "", 0)
00057 
00058                 if (str_done == 0) str_allocate();
00059                 }
00060 
00061         virtual ~URPCMethod()
00062                 {
00063                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCMethod)
00064                 }
00065 
00066         // GLOBAL SERVICES
00067 
00068         static URPCFault* pFault;
00069         static URPCEncoder* encoder;
00070 
00071         static bool hasFailed()
00072                 {
00073                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCMethod::hasFailed()")
00074 
00075                 bool result = (pFault != 0);
00076 
00077                 U_RETURN(result);
00078                 }
00079 
00080         // VIRTUAL METHOD
00081 
00082         virtual UString getHeaderContent() const { return UString::getStringNull(); }
00083 
00084         // Used to get the name of the method. This is matched up using the URPCObject dispatcher to respond to a call
00085 
00086         virtual UString getMethodName() const { return UString::getStringNull(); }
00087 
00088         // Transforms the method into something that servers and clients can send. The encoder holds the
00089         // actual data while the client hands data to be entered in. This makes a whole lot more sense in the
00090         // samples that should have shipped with the library
00091 
00092         virtual void encode()
00093                 {
00094                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCMethod::encode()")
00095 
00096                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT(false) // If this assert fires, you need to implement the method
00097                 }
00098 
00099         // Only to be called on the server by the dispatcher.
00100         // This method executes the call and returns true if the call succeeded, false if it failed.
00101         // URPCMethod should keep any return data in a member variable. The information will be returned via a call to encode
00102 
00103         virtual bool execute(URPCEnvelope& theCall)
00104                 {
00105                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCMethod::execute(%p)", &theCall)
00106 
00107                 // If this assert fires, you need to implement the method.
00108                 // We include a default implementation because client-side Methods should never call execute.
00109 
00110                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT(false)
00111 
00112                 U_RETURN(false);
00113                 }
00114 
00115         // DEBUG
00116 
00117 #ifdef DEBUG
00118         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00119 #endif
00120 
00121 private:
00122         URPCMethod(const URPCMethod&)            {}
00123         URPCMethod& operator=(const URPCMethod&) { return *this; }
00124 };
00125 
00126 #endif
